div.p: Greetings. I did not know whether I would have a courier available due to our fairs, during which there is a great scarcity of couriers, and therefore I did not want to write to Mr. Collin, whose letters, however, were delivered to me; for there was a risk that I might write in vain. I also bought Rhaetian wine for Doctor Gesner, but I could not write because on Monday evening I was not sure about the messenger and I had many other letters to write concerning this bishop's business. The Rhaetian churches also trouble us, and the Jesuits are returning.

The business against the bishop has proceeded quite successfully so far; but we await the outcome. The outcome proves the deeds; I wish that anyone who thinks deeds should be judged by the outcome may lack success.
To the most distinguished man, excellent in learning and piety, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant Antistes of the Church of Zurich, his lord and patron.
